designer.title: Part Designer
designer.tagline: I value things with a clear structure, clean style, purpose-driven elements, and thought-provoking interactions.

developer.title: Part Developer
developer.tagline: I'm always trying to build things that enhance productivity, creativity, and accessibility to important information.

human.title: Part Human
human.tagline: I'm an American currently living in Copenhagen. If I'm not behind my screen, I'm probably outside exploring the city.

profile.title: Profile:
text: Hi, I'm Andrew Smith. I’m a multidisciplinary designer bridging between the fields of architecture, computation, and application development. I have a combined 10 years of academic and professional experience in architecture, in which I hold a B.Arch & MA degree. I'm passionate about design, technology, and really anything to do with putting things together.

Early in my studies, I grew a passion for using programming and scripting as design tools. Later, in practice, I found immense value in applying these tools (and computational thinking in general) toward solving process-based challenges on projects like

. At HKS Architects, I worked with teams of all shapes and sizes on dozens of projects primarily in the sports/venues sector. These projects ranged from quick week-long design proposals to multi-year construction administration assistance.
Now, having recently graduated from the Computation in Architecture MA program at the Royal Danish Academy, I’m actively developing several applications including
. These projects help keep me up-to-date with new tools, libraries, and frameworks.

I'm also seeking a full-time position to leverage my computational and development skills on innovative projects. So, whether it's an employment inquiry, collaborating on a project, discussing app ideas, or simply saying hi, feel free to reach out, and let's put something amazing together!

entries.title: Open-Source Developer
entries.desc: I am actively developing and maintaining two open-source projects: StadiumTools: C# library & plug-in for parametrically modeling stadiums. Lepidoptera: Web platform for architects to explore ecological datasets.

entries.title: Metal Workshop Tutor
entries.desc: I maintained after-hours operation of the academy's metal shop. In this role, I assisted students with the fabrication of academic projects as they related to pipe bending, sheet metal forming, laser-cutting, and casting.

entries.title: BLOXHUB AEC Hackathon
entries.desc: OpenMaterialData was a team effort to prototype an open-source data framework to boost the usability of product information by introducing machine-readable open standards for declaring architectural products.

entries.title: Architectural Designer
entries.desc: Working across teams, I supported the design, documentation, and construction of several state-of-the-art entertainment venues. I also participated in over two dozen design competitions across several sectors. My work focused on parametric modeling, design, and interoperability solutions to improve the speed & quality of the design & documentation.

entries.title: Film History T.A.
entries.desc: I supported several of SCI-Arc's film history classes as a TA by kicking off topical discussions, managing film screenings, and grading written assignments. My tasks also included digitizing course materials and guiding students in analyzing films, aiming to enhance their understanding of cinematic criticism and encouraging thoughtful communication.

entries.title: Computation in Architecture (M.A.A)
entries.desc: I've developed a comprehensive knowledge of computational techniques (programming, digital fabrication, robotics), and gained practical skills in applying that knowledge to solve architectural design problems focused around reducing the ecological footprint of building methods & materials.

entries.title: CREATE Summer School
entries.desc: This Summer program focused on exploring data-driven tectonic construction, and the production of 1:1 scale prototypes that aimed at advancing wood architecture through the use of novel digital design-to-fabrication workflows. Concepts introduced included performance-driven aggregations, circular assemblies, and wood forming through programmed material behavior.

entries.title: Bachelor of Architecture (B.Arch)
entries.desc: In this program, I've gained core competencies of the architectural design profession with an emphasis on innovation and experimentation within topics of architectural design theory, practice, technology, and research.
